news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The system has also fostered several management tools that are valuable to local agencies in designing and building new transit projects.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The fundamental problem is that the New Starts process is unreasonably onerous for New Starts grantees.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: In its effort to exercise due diligence over Federal funds and the New Starts program, FTA has developed a system so complex, so replete with reports and analyses, and so fraught with delays and schedule uncertainty, that it now obstructs one of the agency's fundamental goals -- to assist urban areas in building critically needed transit systems in a cost effective manner.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The result is delay and frustration for New Starts project sponsors, and even in some cases decisions by grantees to design and build new fixed guideway projects without Federal discretionary funding.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: To put this in some perspective, the FTA New Starts Program consists today of the following key elements: First, project sponsors (the local agency grantee) must make detailed New Starts submittals to the FTA on an annual basis providing extensive information on their proposed project.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Based on these submittals, FTA evaluates and rates the projects under two statutory/regulatory criteria: -- Project Justification, which evaluates cost effectiveness, land use, environmental benefits, mobility improvements, economic development, and operating efficiencies.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Third, almost all projects must obtain full clearance under the National Environmental Policy Act (NEPA).

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: This means preparation of a Draft and Final Environmental Impact Statement (EIS) and issuance of a Record of Decision (ROD) by FTA.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: While clearly justified as a matter of public policy, the EIS process as administered by FTA is extremely time consuming, with frequent delays and the resulting schedule uncertainty.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Finally, in order to be eligible for construction funding and receipt of a Full Funding Grant Agreement (FFGA), a project sponsor must make its way through a time consuming FTA "due diligence" and project review process.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The project sponsor must develop a lengthy series of project reports and documents, and provide detailed project cost, revenue, scope, and schedule information to FTA.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: There are significant "soft" costs - primarily the staff and consultant time required to prepare and revise the extensive documents and reports required by FTA, consult and meet regularly with FTA and its consultants, submit New Start reports on the project, etc.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: In addition, there are escalation costs incurred simply because the engineering, design, and construction process takes longer under the Federal process.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Even if escalation is relatively modest -- 5% per year, for example -- the cost of a one year delay on a $1 billion project would be $50 million in taxpayer dollars.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: In particular, over a two-year period like that noted above in the comparison of the Eastside and Exposition projects, the costs of construction materials (such as steel) can increase significantly.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Given that providing sufficient revenue sources to build a major project is always a challenge, these extra costs can have a substantial negative impact on a local agency's ability to meet a project budget.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: One critical aspect of this comparison bears emphasis.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: No one can really take issue with the idea that projects should be carefully managed and reviewed, or that FTA should be a conscientious steward of the Federal funds it provides.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: However, we have not found in Los Angeles that the current micro-management level of Federal oversight has any actual, demonstrable yield in terms of project success or performance.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Our Federal New Starts projects do not have a better record, for example, of being completed on time and within budget than our non-Federal projects.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: In fact, due to the delays and added costs of the Federal process, actually the opposite seems to be true.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: One of the primary reasons for this, I believe, is that agencies like Metro have developed sound project management systems and tools that have greatly enhanced our ability to build projects on time and within budget.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Certainly the FTA should be credited with assisting us in achieving that goal, through its technical assistance and its emphasis on project management.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: We believe that is an appropriate role for the Federal Government.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: However, I am not aware of any empirical evidence, on a nationwide basis, that the ever increasing levels and layers of Federal review and micro- management have actually resulted in better performing projects, in terms of adherence to schedule and budget.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: SPECIFIC RECOMMENDATIONS FOR CHANGE In a nutshell, FTA's elaborate project development and "due diligence" structure creates enormous problems in terms of time and resources for grantees trying to build New Starts projects.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: New Starts projects are multi-million dollar public works projects, and as such require development and adherence to a strict critical path schedule.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The unfortunate fact is that in the implementation of a New Starts project, one of the biggest risk factors has become the Federal Government's well intentioned but inefficient rules governing the New Starts process.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: If the New Starts program continues in its present form, the future will be increased frustration for project sponsors, delay in project development and completion, and deferred benefits to those dependent on transit.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Cities with the resources to build projects outside the FTA New Starts system will do so; cities without those resources will either struggle through the Federal process or in some cases perhaps forego needed projects.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: However, there are steps that can be taken collectively to address the current problems and improve the program.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: More importantly, the current FTA approach fails to take into account the actual level of risk to the Federal Government, and the extent to which that risk has been transferred to the local project sponsor/grantee.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Specifically, for a number of years FTA has utilized the FFGA to limit its financial exposure in New Starts projects, by placing an absolute limit or "cap" on the amount of Section 5309 New Starts funds that will be provided for the Project.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: This shifts all of the risk for cost increases, overruns, scope changes, and schedule delays to the grantee.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Moreover, in the FFGA the grantee expressly commits to paying all project cost increases, and thereby by contract assumes all of the financial risk.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The current New Starts model is fundamentally counter-intuitive, in that it requires that the Federal Government perform an extensive and time-consuming due diligence and risk assessment role, but it places essentially no financial risk on the Federal Government.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: In light of the actual allocation of risk, a far more justifiable approach would be to place the primary burden for risk assessment and due diligence on the party actually bearing the financial risk, and for the FTA to limit the amount and scope of the Federal Government's review.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: A change in this element of the evaluation would not only recognize the true level of local financial commitment, but would also provide a tangible incentive for increased levels of State and local funding.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: Establish a Bilateral Commitment to Timeframes The New Starts program could be improved by FTA committing to a schedule and milestones for its actions and approvals.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The combined effect of the due diligence reviews, the NEPA process, the requirement for FTA approval to advance from one stage to the next, and the FFGA process creates havoc for the grantee's project schedule, both in uncertainty and in the amount of time taken to make it though the process to FFGA execution.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: One fact is quite startling -- the Federal Government is the only participant in the New Starts Project development process that does not have to make any commitments regarding the schedule for its actions.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The project sponsor, local funding partners, and the engineering, design, and construction firms involved must all agree to and comply with specific timetables for their actions.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The New Starts process would benefit greatly if FTA were simply to adopt a more disciplined and time sensitive approach for its actions in each of the steps in the process, and were to make the type of milestone and schedule commitments that other participants in the process are already obligated to make.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: For example, FTA and the New Starts grantee could agree to a bilateral schedule for the processing of the NEPA documents and the multiple other plans and reports required in the New Starts process, as well as for the preliminary engineering and final design approval processes.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: As a general rule, when a ROD is issued by a Federal agency, the underlying Federal action may proceed.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: However, under the FTA New Starts process, there are additional and time consuming post-ROD steps and approvals that must occur before a grantee may actually commence design and construction of its project -- specifically, the often lengthy process of obtaining FTA's approval to enter final design, and the detailed and time consuming development of the FFGA package and accompanying reports.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: The net result is that the time from issuance of the ROD until the execution of the FFGA is typically well over a year, and frequently is two years or more-which means that actual construction of the project is delayed for that period of time.

news_title: NEW STARTS AND SMALL STARTS TRANSIT PROGRAMS
sentence: FTA could greatly improve the New Starts process, and save time and public funds, if following the issuance of the ROD the grantee were permitted to proceed with design and at least limited construction activities.

news_title: Calls It Response to Reaganomics;
sentence: He charged that the grants were merely a "thin disguise" for future cuts in social programs.

news_title: Calls It Response to Reaganomics;
sentence: The increase in state spending that Hughes is asking for was fashioned by juggling dollars, programs and jobs.

news_title: Calls It Response to Reaganomics;
sentence: It was made possible by a surprise $150 million surplus for this year that resulted partly from a tight 1981-82 budget, from an unexpected windfall of interest earned on state investments, and the delayed startup of a competitive D.C. lottery--circumstances that the governor cannot control, and that are not likely to recur.

news_title: Calls It Response to Reaganomics;

sentence: Now the Metropolitan Transportation Authority is reassessing how it will develop the final 13 stations of the project amid criticism that its construction costs exceeded those of comparable undertakings around the world and that the first phase took decades too long.

news_title: MTA Rethinks Approach to Second Avenue Subway
sentence: MTA Chairman Thomas Prendergast said in an interview that for the second phase he is aiming to use a "design-build" model, a process that is intended to save time by relying on a single firm to design and construct a project.

news_title: MTA Rethinks Approach to Second Avenue Subway
sentence: He is also planning to negotiate with labor unions and MTA officials said engineers will explore new and more efficient techniques in tunneling.

news_title: MTA Rethinks Approach to Second Avenue Subway
sentence: He also cited collective bargaining agreements with strict rules about worker hours and pay and said he hopes there will be some rule changes for the next phases.

news_title: MTA Rethinks Approach to Second Avenue Subway
sentence: Rich Fitzsimmons, a spokesman for the "Sandhogs," the subway construction worker union, responded: "Labor is not the problem."

news_title: MTA Rethinks Approach to Second Avenue Subway
sentence: Mr. Fitzsimmons said costs could have been cut if the subway had been dug deeper so laborers were not working around utility lines and other obstacles overseen by various government agencies that added time and complexities to the project.

news_title: MTA Rethinks Approach to Second Avenue Subway
sentence: For his part, Mr. Cuomo, who oversees the MTA, has said that he pushed to keep the agency to a tight schedule since taking office in 2011 and that if he could go back and redo the project, "I would not have done it the way we did it."

news_title: MTA Rethinks Approach to Second Avenue Subway
sentence: David Gunn, a transit expert who ran the New York City subways in the late 1980s, said he recalled planning the project when he was in charge.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Transit projects typically run either through city streets or in existing railroad corridors, are usually quite large, and involve coordination with a number of agencies and localities.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The sheer size of the projects offers challenges and opportunities to achieve economies of scale.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Numerous underground utilities are likely present, but often not well identified ahead of time.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: A large right-of-way acquisition effort is typically required to secure needed land from many small owners and/or a large railroad.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The need for community support and regulatory approvals presents its own set of difficulties.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The fundamental question posed is, "Why is the owner, the party least knowledgeable of the A/E/C process, ultimately held responsible for the actions of architects and constructors?"

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: This question is at the core of the issues discussed here.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: UNIQUE ASPECTS OF TRANSIT PROJECTS- Project management professionals who find themselves involved in transit projects must be ready to run a gauntlet of multiple priorities such as: obtaining/managing a diverse funding stream, acquiring right-of-way, relocating utilities, and constructing the civil/systems infrastructure, while at the same time satisfying a large number of private and public stakeholders.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: With so many variables and unknowns, it is not surprising that many transit projects run over original budgets and schedules.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: They typically cost at least $100 million and can often exceed $1 billion and thus are usually funded by a mix of financing that may include state/federal grants, local sales/property tax, and municipal bonds.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Transit projects are also long and linear in nature, usually traversing many kilometers of urban/suburban neighborhoods and involving a number of stakeholders including regulatory agencies, municipalities, and community organizations.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: This long, linear configuration results in right-of-way acquistion and utility relocation efforts that qualify as large projects in their own right.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Like many transit projects, Tasman West was the beneficiary of a Full Funding Grant Agreement (FFGA).

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: This is an agreement between the owner agency and the Federal Transit Administration (FTA) wherein the baseline budget, schedule and funding plan are established and the owner agency commits to completing the project and operating it once it is built.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: FFGA's are the end result of a long process of federal and state appropriations and negotiations between the owner agency and the FTA.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: On the other hand, Tasman East, Capitol, Vasona and the vehicle procurement project took a different path since they were primarily locally funded.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Locally funded projects require a citizenry that believes in the projects and trusts the owner agency enough to tax themselves to make the projects happen.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: While VTA's construction contractors typically relocate storm drain and sewer lines, the utility companies that own gas, electric, water and communications lines usually insist on relocating their own facilities.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The window for performing relocation work is a relatively short time frame between rightof-way acquisition and the start of civil construction.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Late completion of utility relocations can have impacts that ripple through the civil, stations, and systems construction phases causing loss of productivity, crowding, and ultimately higher costs and delays.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The light rail projects in our case study experienced large increases in utility relocation costs over the baseline budget.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Tasman West utility overruns were primarily due to sewer and storm drain conflicts that resulted in schedule recovery costs.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The unexpected Chapter 11 bankruptcy filing of the 1OO year old Pacific Gas and Electric Company resulting from the California Energy Crisis in 2001 was a major contributor to the Tasman East and Capitol construction overruns, as was a higher than expected water line relocation cost.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The Vasona overrun was primarily due to the budgeting assumption that, since much of the project runs in a dedicated rail corridor, utility relocation costs would be minimal.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: In fact, while not many utilities ran parallel to the corridor, utilities that intersected the corridor at street crossings required relocation at a substantial cost.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Based on lessons learned from this experience, VTA is augmenting its current utility relocation procedures on upcoming projects.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: VTA has developed long-term relationships with local utility companies and has a dedicated utility coordination staff, many of whom are past utility company employees.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: These relationships are crucial in getting utility companies to place a priority on VTA's work.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: VTA enters into cooperative agreements with utility companies as early as possible in order to formalize cost splits, cost estimates and schedule commitments and has set up escrow accounts to expedite payment, where necessary.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: For large projects, VTA will pay for representatives from the larger utility companies and co-locate those individuals with project design staff in order to expedite identification and location of conflicting utilities.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: VTA plans to make greater use of old-fashioned potholing as well as modern utility detection techniques in order to more accurately locate both the alignment and depth of utilities.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Getting timely invoices from some utilities can also be a challenge.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: For this reason, it is essential to maintain accurate records of utility company labor and equipment resources on a daily basis in order to forecast and eventually validate invoices that may not come for months or years after work is performed.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: RIGHT OF WAY ACQUISITION-Perhaps the most unique aspect of transit projects is the large right-of-way acquisition effort typically required.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Schedule risk in the right-of-way acquisition process arises from the need for proper execution on a large number of parcels simultaneously.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: In order to avoid delays to the start of construetion, VTA developed detailed right-of-way acquisition plans that modeled the typical activities for one parcel and repeated this network for each parcel to be acquired.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The resulting schedule, organized by construction package, contained several thousand activities, and was updated regularly until VTA obtained legal possession or right of entry of all required parcels.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: On the four projects studied, VTA never had to delay the start of a construction package due to late right-of-way acquisition.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Much of the cost risk inherent in the right-of-way acquisition process can be mitigated through the use of accurate unit prices when setting budgets.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Of special significance for transit projects is the state agency that regulates the safety of operating rail lines - in California it is the California Public Utilities Commission (CPUC).

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The CPUC approves all street crossings and certifies that rail lines are safe prior to starting service.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Special attention must be paid to track crossing applications submitted to the CPUC because, if rejected, they have the potential to significantly delay work and add millions of dollars in costs.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: This is exactly what occurred on the Vasona project.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The rejection of a single at-grade street crossing on that project ultimately led to an 18-month delay and $10.8 million in extra design and construction costs, as an elevated, gradeseparated crossing was ultimately required.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: On the Tasman West project, VTA spent $2 million adding a pedestrian tunnel under the tracks and a massive barrier gate across an expressway as the result of unfavorable CPUC rulings late in the design process.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Project managers should also take the process of safety certification seriously as it too has the potential to delay project opening.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Due to their long, linear nature, transit projects directly impact many more residents, businesses, and municipalities than most other types of projects.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: It is critical to project success that affected parties are brought into the project delivery process.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Cities traversed by the project typically review the design, inspect construction of elements (such as traffic signals and street lights) that will become city property, and take ownership of some right-ofway parcels acquired to build the project.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Staffing constraints at the cities can impose delays in all of these areas, and cities can be a major source of scope creep during the design and construction process.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: As a proactive measure to avoid these pitfalls, project managers may consider paying the cities for dedicated review and inspection staff, co-located with project design and construction management staff, and should implement a strong change control board with the power to resist the cities' demands for enhancements.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: A strong community outreach effort opens lines of communications with affected residents, businesses, and the general public.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The top risk factors, in order of cost impact, were: Construction * utility relocation costs; * unforeseen conditions; * unfavorable regulatory decisions; * design and management services; AND * real estate ecquistion.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Table 3 shows how these risks played out on the four projects in our case study.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: By far, the largest drivers of cost increases were utility relocation costs and unforeseen conditions.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: We have discussed utility relocation costs in some detail, but have not delved into unforeseen conditions - a risk factor on any construction project.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: In our experience on the projects in the case study, these conditions took the form of a high groundwater table, the discovery of contaminated soil and groundwater, and one of the wettest rainy seasons on record during a time of major earthwork operations.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Rounding out the list of risk factors are unfavorable regulatory decisions and real estate acquisition, which we have covered, and design and management services.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: In our experience, design and management costs grew in proportion to construction cost growth due to additional construction oversight and coordination time required to manage the greater work effort and to process the resulting volume of design and contract changes.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: The projects in our case study were quite successful.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: They were all delivered on or ahead of schedule, with only a 4.2% bottom-line increase over the baseline budget.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: However, with the full benefit of 20/20 hindsight, these projects would have been more successful if sufficient contingency had been included in the baseline budgets to mitigate the risk factors we have discussed.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Table 4 shows growth, from baseline, of all project areas except contingency.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Another way to address the risk factors we have discussed is to keep project contingency at a lower level, say 5%, and to allocate higher contingency allowances to the categories with the most risk.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: If this approach is a chosen, project managers should look closely at the areas of utility relocation, unforeseen conditions and regulatory risk factors.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Also, remember to include design and management allocated contingency in proportion to construction contingency to account for cost growth resulting from the need to manage the greater work effort arising from construction increases.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: In summary, besides the typical risks present in capital improvement projects, transit projects present a unique combination of challenges arising from their large size, extensive utility relocation effort, massive right-of-way acquisition phase, and considerable scrutiny by agencies, municipalities, and the public.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: Good project management practices and tools can overcome these challenges.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: With an understanding of the unique aspects of transit projects, project managers can seek to mitigate risks where possible, and to build sufficient contingency into baseline budgets to offset those that remain.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: By addressing the risks, transit project managers can reap the rewards of successful on time and on budget project delivery.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: References REFERENCES 1. Beley, Doug, "Change Leadership from the Brink," American Public Transportation Association 2002 TransITech, 2002.

news_title: Management Challenges Unique to Transit Projects
sentence: 2. Berlin, Susan, "VTA Saves $2.8 million with OwnerControlled insurance Program," This Week in Passenger I Transport, February 9, 2004 available at com/passenger_transport/thisweek/ 040209_4.

news_title: PUBLIC FORUM READERS CHEER, JEER CUTS IN RED LINE SUBWAY FUNDS:  [VALLEY Edition ]
sentence: For a long time now I have attended and testified at meetings of the MTA board.

news_title: PUBLIC FORUM READERS CHEER, JEER CUTS IN RED LINE SUBWAY FUNDS:  [VALLEY Edition ]
sentence: I have written many letters and talked to politicians, including those in the White House, making them aware of: the sloppy work, thin walls, wooden wedges, huge cost overruns, Hollywood Boulevard dropping, giveaways to the Community Redevelopment Agency, a sinking bridge, mitigation funds for other than mitigation, men in the tunnel when it was filling with water due to the sink hole, the Lankershim Boulevard sinkage, the El Sombrero nightclub sinkage, the poor treatment of the property and business owners, the loss of businesses because of MTA construction - and now dewatering and the sinkage in the Hollywood Hills.

news_title: PUBLIC FORUM READERS CHEER, JEER CUTS IN RED LINE SUBWAY FUNDS:  [VALLEY Edition ]
sentence: The MTA needs to clean house; stop giving money to the CRA, Alameda Corridor and the homeless; cut its lobbying staff and get down to the business of transportation.

news_title: PUBLIC FORUM READERS CHEER, JEER CUTS IN RED LINE SUBWAY FUNDS:  [VALLEY Edition ]
sentence: - Chris Shabel Hollywood Stakeholders Alliance Hollywood The recent actions of Congress radically slashing funding for the $300 million-a-mile Red Line subway is a sobering reminder of the fiscal realities associated with building the most costly public works project in you.S.

news_title: PUBLIC FORUM READERS CHEER, JEER CUTS IN RED LINE SUBWAY FUNDS:  [VALLEY Edition ]
sentence: Congress is no longer interested in rubber-stamping a project beset with construction problems, cost overruns and billion-dollar lawsuits, where only special-interest needs are served and not those of the taxpayers.

sentence: By bringing the subway out of the ground and shifting to a reasonable light-rail line, our air will be cleaner and gridlock will be reduced in this decade.

news_title: PUBLIC FORUM READERS CHEER, JEER CUTS IN RED LINE SUBWAY FUNDS:  [VALLEY Edition ]
sentence: Revitalization of our economy will be the result without the subway boondoggle.

sentence: Universal level boarding from all new station platforms and designated key stations on the City Subway were also requirements.

news_title: NJ transit chooses super-turnkey
sentence: Seven different vehicle options were considered, with a partial low-floor vehicle with low level platform loading emerging as the preferred choice.

news_title: NJ transit chooses super-turnkey
sentence: Originally, NJ Transit expected to develop the Hudson-Bergen project under a conventional design-bid-build procedure.

news_title: NJ transit chooses super-turnkey
sentence: An initial project schedule would have had construction under way in 1995 and trains running by the end of 1999.

news_title: NJ transit chooses super-turnkey
sentence: But this schedule was scuttled due to route alignment controversies that delayed completion of the federal record of decision process, and projected severe cutbacks in the annual FTA funding commitment to the project.

news_title: NJ transit chooses super-turnkey
sentence: Projected inflation over this extended period would substantially increase the total cost of the work, and the extended schedule would delay the availability of new transportation capacity that was seen as vital to the continued redevelopment of the waterfront area.

news_title: NJ transit chooses super-turnkey
sentence: Under pressure to reduce the prospective costs and bring at least part of the rail system on line as originally scheduled, NJ Transit shifted to a design-build procurement approach.

news_title: NJ transit chooses super-turnkey
sentence: Because of the construction cash flow shortfall that was anticipated from constrained annual FTA grants, it was also decided to include some form of project financing by the design-build team.

news_title: NJ transit chooses super-turnkey

news_title: NJ transit chooses super-turnkey
sentence: The additional costs associated with financing the project were expected to be substantially less than the cost of inflation for a delayed project.
